title: 113_s2675
content:
SECTION 1. PRESIDENTIAL ACTIONS IN RESPONSE TO VIOLATIONS OF RELIGIOUS FREEDOM. Section 401(b)(2) of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to require the President to take action within 90 days of each report on violations of religious freedom in foreign countries. The President must take action within 90 days of each report on violations of religious freedom in foreign countries, or a commensurate action until certifying satisfaction of requirements under sections 403 and 404. SEC. 2. Presidential actions in response to severe violations of religious freedom. Designations of Countries of Particular Concern for Religious Freedom under the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 are amended to require the President to review reports within 90 days and designate countries accordingly. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to require the President to review reports within 90 days and designate countries accordingly. Changes include specifying deadlines and redesignating clauses for clarity. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to require the President to review reports within 90 days and designate countries accordingly, with specific deadlines and clarity in clauses. Countries recommended by the commission must be addressed if not designated as countries of particular concern for religious freedom. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to require the President to submit a report to Congress explaining the reasons for not designating a country as a country of particular concern for religious freedom. Designated countries must retain their designation until the President determines otherwise and reports to the relevant committees in Congress. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to require the President to submit a report to Congress explaining the reasons for not designating a country as a country of particular concern for religious freedom. The President must include a description of the impact of the sanctions and explain why they satisfy the requirements of the subsection. SEC. 3. CONSULTATIONS.

Section 403(a) of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to require consultations within 90 days.

SEC. 4. PRESIDENTIAL WAIVER.

Section 407(a) of the Act is amended to allow the President to waive sanctions for a 180-day period.

SEC. 5. TERMINATION OF PRESIDENTIAL ACTIONS.

Section 409 of the Act is amended to simplify the termination process.
